pros: Flexible and kind boss. Classes were easy.
cons: Not a good location for young people.

pros: One-on-one student attention. Faculty and staff who truly care about students.
cons:
Upper administration is completely out of touch with students and faculty, and has no desire to be in touch. CFO has too much power to cut budgets with no regard to its long term impact. For example, college recently eliminates its enrollment management division and thousands of dollars of current student scholarships, then acts surprised when retention drops. Upper administration using bullying tactics and threats to silence faculty and staff who ask questions. 

Morale is devastated. Faculty that are loved by students are leaving in droves, and numbers show students are beginning to follow.

pros: My boss is pretty cool
cons: The pay is the worst I've ever had

pros: Flexible with working hours and schedule
cons: Low pay, part time, long

pros: The students are good to work with.
cons: Everything else is toxic, poor management and black balling, poor financial spending, terrible benefits. They have at least one federal lawsuit against them and they just settled another.

job_title: Assistant Professor, Physics in Mount Airy, GA
pros: Good health insurance, small class sizes, low cost of living
cons: Below average pay, rural location

pros:
Open minded environment 
Great benefits
Great vacation and sick time
Friendly
cons: Pay could use adjusting at times

review_title: Great place to work as a student
pros: Flexible the student schedules/ works with students
cons: There is no cons of working here

pros: I made some amazing memories and I had a blast working with the students and professors!
cons: There were not any negatives in this job.

review_title: Takes good care of its employees
pros: friendly working environment and helpful coworkers
cons:
low pay
no water in the office

pros: Great collaborations with other students, faculty and staff to create imaginative programs and events for other students on campus.  An entire suite to yourself.
cons: Most of the school thinks that you are out to get them because you actually enforce the rules that the students said that they would follow when they signed up to attend Piedmont College.

pros: The only pro is that I was able to leave this backwater institution fairly quickly and get a job at a REAL institution of higher learning without much difficulty.
cons: Unmotivated students, low pay, horrible communication between everyone, no community spirit, ineffective leadership.

review_title: Nice place to work. Fun environment.
pros: The people that make up the company are very nice and fun to work with. You receive free tuition along with your stipend as a graduate assistant.
cons: Administration doesn't know what they're doing. President and some of those closest to him are running the school into the ground. The board needs to address the issue soon.

pros: I enjoy the part time work. I enjoy working with teachers.  Everyone is so nice.
cons: I don't have any cons to share. It is a very positive place to be.

pros: the employer was understanding when I needed to study instead of work, but we still made sure the work was done at the end of the day. everyone was positive and loved their jobs.
cons: can't really say anything negative.

pros:
Closet-knit environment
Friendly people, students and faculty included
Numerous opportunities for student-workers
Great place to go to school and/or play college sports
cons:
Compensation is minimum wage
Limits on how many hours students can work per week
Pay is biweekly with a two week offset

pros: Very interested in providing  GA positions to MBA students.
cons: Not very challenging,  not enough experience to put on a resume. Limited number of hours.

job_title: Director of Student Life in Toronto, ON
pros: Good student-teacher ratio. Ability to impact student lives in a big way.
cons: Leadership micromanages.. Stagnant wages. Little advancement opportunity.

pros: There are no pros to this job.
cons: I worked at Piedmont Dining Services. Absolutely horrible. No training, managers don't care what so ever about their employees.  Cockroaches are often found everywhere. The director is sexist and has made a student cry. They are always looking for people because new employees are treated poorly and are rarely given any help.

job_title: Graduate Tennis Assistant Coach in Demorest, GA
pros: Great people to work with, very helpful and enthusiastic.
cons: It was only a part time job so no real benefits or compensation.

pros: The benefits are nice. You can get a free education for you or your family.
cons:
The people in charge of most departments are not qualified for management.

Every department is understaffed, over-worked, and underpaid.

People are leaving like mice from a sinking ship.

review_title: I loved working as a Tutor here.
pros: Very flexible hours and no micromanaging.
cons: Compensation was a little low. Also no training was provided.

pros: Gain necessary office and clerical experience
cons: Bad communication between departments and give staff and students the run-around

pros: Plenty of teaching opportunities and very good faculty, staff, and students.
cons: Overloads every semester, lack of support from administration.

pros: Flexible hours, good staff, pay without appointments
cons: fellow tutors, hours not guaranteed

pros: good for life style and location
